intro: Ageratina hebes, commonly known as the white feather plant, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its small, white to pale blue flowers. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, often reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Ageratina hebes is valued in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
